description: **üá¨üáß** After a lot of work (and a lot of rain) the day has finally come. Join us as we plant hundreds of native Portuguese plants to create Lisbon's newest mini-forest. From mighty oaks to beautifully fragrance lavander and rosemary, you'll be a planting history in the city. **Why join us?** This is a wonderful opportunity to connect with your community, learn about native Portuguese plant species, and contribute to a greener Lisbon. Open to the whole family. Plus, spending time in the soil is good for you. Research shows that microorganisms found in soil can help release serotonin‚Äîthe "happiness hormone"‚Äîin our brains. Come get your free dose of nature-led joy! *** **What we will be doing** * **Planting Native Portuguese Trees and Plants:** We follow a method of planting hundreds of a high-density variety of trees, shrubs, and herbs to support a range of biodiversity and grow a forest that sustains itself. Learn about the different species, how to plant correctly, and how you can become a champion of green spaces in Lisbon. *** **Event Details** * **When:** Saturday 28th February at 10:00 to 13:00 * **Meeting Point:** [Rua Alfredo Mesquita](https://maps.app.goo.gl/iaWN7eSQHhoB1Qqa6) * **What to bring:** A reusable water bottle, clothes you don‚Äôt mind getting dirty, sturdy shoes/boots and sun protection. * **What we provide:** All necessary gloves, tools, and plenty of positive energy! *** **Stay Connected** Want to coordinate with the team or have questions before the event? Join our WhatsApp Community to stay in the loop: [https://chat.whatsapp.com/DqNZMG7LvP1Dlrz91ds0mD](https://chat.whatsapp.com/DqNZMG7LvP1Dlrz91ds0mD) *** **The Fine Print** *By participating in this volunteer program, you accept that Urbem Forests is not responsible for any loss, damage or theft of personal items, nor personal injury, incurred during activities. Urbem Forests is not liable for damages caused by volunteers to third parties within the scope of our activities.* **==============================================================** **üáµüáπ** Depois de muito trabalho (e muita chuva), o dia finalmente chegou. Junte-se a n√≥s para plantar centenas de plantas nativas portuguesas e criar a mais nova mini-floresta de Lisboa. De carvalhos imponentes a lavanda e alecrim com fragr√¢ncias maravilhosas, voc√™ estar√° a fazer hist√≥ria na cidade. **Porqu√™ juntar-te a n√≥s?** Esta √© uma oportunidade maravilhosa para se conectar com a sua comunidade, aprender sobre as esp√©cies de plantas nativas portuguesas e contribuir para uma Lisboa mais verde. Aberto a toda a fam√≠lia. Al√©m disso, passar tempo em contacto com a terra faz-te bem. Estudos mostram que os microrganismos encontrados no solo ajudam a libertar serotonina ‚Äî a "hormona da felicidade" ‚Äî no nosso c√©rebro. Vem buscar a tua dose gratuita de alegria na natureza! *** **O que vamos fazer** * **Plantar √°rvores e plantas nativas portuguesas:** Seguimos um m√©todo de plantar centenas de uma variedade de √°rvores, arbustos e ervas de alta densidade para apoiar uma gama de biodiversidade e cultivar uma floresta que se sustenta a si pr√≥pria. Aprenda sobre as diferentes esp√©cies, como plantar corretamente e como pode tornar-se um defensor dos espa√ßos verdes em Lisboa. *** **Detalhes do Evento** * **Quando:** S√°bado, 28 de fevereiro, das 10h √†s 13h * **Ponto de Encontro:** [Rua Alfredo Mesquita](https://maps.app.goo.gl/iaWN7eSQHhoB1Qqa6) * **O que trazer:** Uma garrafa de √°gua reutiliz√°vel, roupas que n√£o se importe de sujar, sapatos/botas resistentes e prote√ß√£o solar. * **O que oferecemos:** Todas as luvas necess√°rias, ferramentas e muita energia positiva! *** **Mant√©m o Contacto** Queres combinar com a equipa ou tens d√∫vidas antes do evento? title: *NEW*üî• üìö A Non-Fiction Book Club For Curious Minds
description: üíå **JOIN our NEW SUBSTACK to read ALL the book summaries üìïüëá** https://rubyrossini.substack.com/ If you have not yet read the book, you are still very welcome to join us. However, in the case of reading a novel, reading it beforehand is strongly encouraged ‚Äî both to deepen your own experience and to enrich the conversation for others. Regardless of whether you have read the book, take the time to go through the summary ( it will be published on Substack a few days before our event ) - it will help to ground the conversation on an even level for everyone on Saturday. It is not AI-written - I write all summaries & think pieces myself, and I aim to make them as in-depth as I possibly can. **For Announcements** **Join our WhatsApp Group.** I will announce here any new events and share the summary for those who are not on Substack: [https://chat.whatsapp.com/G011Ugv9bah08PYlcQFJ4m](https://chat.whatsapp.com/G011Ugv9bah08PYlcQFJ4m) ( This is the announcement group only - **ONLY once you have attended** the event, you'll be able to join *the other group,* which is for the community) ‚õîÔ∏è **No Show** Don't be a üí©. Our waitlist is usually chunky. If you can‚Äôt make it, **change your RSVP,** it only takes a second. Two consecutive no-shows and you will be removed from future signups. **Book of the Month** During our last gathering, we became witnesses to Morrie‚Äôs testament as he approached the end of life ‚Äî a philosophy that called into question what it truly means to live a life of one‚Äôs own. A life that resists social convention and its consumeristic skeleton; a life that honours community, tenderness, and love. *‚ÄúLove is the only rational act.‚Äù* As we enter the so-called romantic month, rather than wading into shallow waters, we choose to descend ‚Äî into one of the most agonising novels ever written on the evasion of self-acceptance, set in a time when not all loves were permitted the dignity of existence, and some were forced underground, repressed beneath the weight of social order. We therefore turn to ***Giovanni's Room by James Baldwin*** ‚Äî a literary masterpiece that examines the cost of self-denial, the architecture of shame, and the quiet devastation such repression inflicts on ourselves, on others, and on the world we help construct. Our first-ever novel, set in the contemporary Paris of American expatriates, liaisons, and quiet violence, follows a young man caught between desire and conventional morality. Devastating and gut-wrenching, yet if there is one book I hope you will read from beginning to end, let it be this one. If you have a problem getting yourself a copy of the book/s, get in touch! **Make a commitment** üëè [üìÖ](https://emojipedia.org/calendar) As the spots fill up pretty quickly, be quick to sign up - but do so **ONLY if you make a real commitment to join.** We have an amazing, committed community that generously shows up, contributes, and gives its best. Sign up only if you are committed and eager to attend. **Mark your calendar** and make a commitment to yourself and your community. **Discussion** For the discussion, we‚Äôll divide in smaller groups of around 4-6 as to have a more intimate environment to facilitate conversations where everyone can feel welcome to participate at their pace. **About Us** Welcome to "Curious Collective" ‚Äì A Non-Fiction Book Club for Curious Minds. If you find yourself here, chance is, you are curious. You are a wanderer, an explorer of ideas, seeking the 'whys' and 'hows' of our world, of what makes us human. In a culture dominated by ‚Äúhyper-connectivity‚Äù, we often lose sight of what truly matters; the treasure of ancient wisdom, the beauty of curiosity, and the profound meaning of community. The Curious Collective is here to rekindle those flames. üî• We believe in the power of shared ideas, meaningful conversations, and sharing the journey. As Joseph Addison wisely said, "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." Our collective mission is to exercise our minds, curiosity, and sense of belonging to a community of like-minded people. **We are not:** Intellectual W\*nkers or debate-club warriors here. We keep it real, there is no intellectual or self-righteous snobbery here. **We are:** Ordinary humans who crave knowledge, connection‚Äîsomeone to chat with, share ideas, and journey alongside. **Tips:** I suggest having a notebook/ a place where you can take notes of the most interesting parts & thoughts you had - this is going to be very helpful for the discussion. Stay Curious ‚Äì for there's always more to discover.

title: John O‚ÄôKeeffe: Surviving Myself - Comedy, Work In Progress Show!
description: Award-winning Irish comedian John O‚ÄôKeeffe is back with his brand-new work-in-progress show, Surviving Myself. Fresh from a sold-out Edinburgh Fringe run in 2024, John is bringing his third solo show and brutally honest humor to Lisbon with Republic of Comedy in the legendary Xafarix! In this new show, he‚Äôll be sharing tales of disastrous relationships, awkward therapy sessions, and the constant struggle to love yourself in a world that never stops judging. Luckily having a knack for turning life‚Äôs low points into big laughs allows John to dive headfirst into topics like mental health, dating disasters, and the existential dread of trying to get your act together. His comedy is personal and upbeat, sometimes dark, but always hilarious‚Äîself-help meets self-sabotage, and plenty Irish sarcasm along the way.
